qas.question: What happened to Joseph I in 1758?
Who was implicated in the attempted assassination of Joseph I?

answers.text: The Távora family and the Duke of Aveiro

qas.question: Who was expelled from the country after the assassination attempt on Joseph I?
What act finally broke the power of the aristocracy?

answers.text: Sebastião de Melo prosecuted every person involved, even women and children

qas.question: In what year did Joseph I make his minister the Count of Oeiras?

context: Following the earthquake, Joseph I gave his Prime Minister even more power, and Sebastião de Melo became a powerful, progressive dictator. As his power grew, his enemies increased in number, and bitter disputes with the high nobility became frequent. In 1758 Joseph I was <a0_0>wounded in an attempted assassination<a0_0/>. <a1_0>The Távora family and the Duke of Aveiro<a1_0/> were implicated and executed after a quick trial. <a2_0>The Jesuits<a2_0/> were expelled from the country and their assets confiscated by the crown. <a3_0>Sebastião de Melo prosecuted every person involved, even women and children<a3_0/>. This was the final stroke that broke the power of the aristocracy. Joseph I made his loyal minister Count of Oeiras in <a4_0>1759<a4_0/>.
